com.sdo.utils.log

Class EachLaunchFileAppender

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.log4j.AppenderSkeleton
      • org.apache.log4j.WriterAppender
        • org.apache.log4j.FileAppender
          • com.sdo.utils.log.EachLaunchFileAppender
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.log4j.Appender, org.apache.log4j.spi.OptionHandler

    public class EachLaunchFileAppender
extends org.apache.log4j.FileAppender
    Provides a log file per execution. The processing is done during initilaisation. We check if a log file of the same name already exists, if so, we back the previous one as "logfilename.1". We can keep track of several back ups (see the maxLogArchives property), by shiffting their number (ie if "logfilename.1" exists, rename to "logfilename.2" and "logfilename" becomes "logfilename.1" and we log to "logfilename" ). cf http://news.gmane.org/find-root.php?message_id=%3cc83e39890610250805l1ca82c4v3cbbd223b83f13d8%40mail.gmail.com%3e 
     log4j.rootLogger=DEBUG, exeroll
 log4j.appender.exeroll=EachLaunchFileAppender
 log4j.appender.exeroll.File=./log/client.log
 # optional, default is 5
 log4j.appender.exeroll.maxLogArchives=10
 log4j.appender.exeroll.layout=org.apache.log4j.PatternLayout
 log4j.appender.exeroll.layout.ConversionPattern=%d{ABSOLUTE} [%t] [%-5p] [%-25.48c{1}] - %m - [%l] %n
    This is just a quick hack, it works for me, do whatever you want with it Date: 25 oct. 2006
    Author:
    Chris Dillon
